000001.question: What would you need to believe about yourself in order to dream without limits?
000001.quote: Believe you can and you’re halfway there.
000001.author: Theodore Roosevelt

000002.question: What’s scarier to you—falling short of your dreams, or realizing you’ve always had the power to reach them?
000002.quote: Our deepest fear is not that we are inadequate. Our deepest fear is that we are powerful beyond measure.
000002.author: Marianne Williamson

000003.question: What would your life look like if you fully committed to becoming the person your dreams require?
000003.quote: You must expect great things of yourself before you can do them.
000003.author: Michael Jordan

000004.question: If your future self could hand you one bold decision to make today, what would it be?
000004.quote: In the middle of every difficulty lies opportunity.
000004.author: Albert Einstein

000005.question: If you knew your dream would work—but only if you never looked back—would you still go?
000005.quote: Once we accept our limits, we go beyond them.
000005.author: Albert Einstein

000006.question: What would your life look like if you had never learned to doubt yourself?
000006.quote: The real voyage of discovery consists not in seeking new landscapes, but in having new eyes.
000006.author: Marcel Proust

000007.question: If your thoughts from the past 24 hours were projected onto a wall, would you recognize yourself?
000007.quote: Until you make the unconscious conscious, it will direct your life and you will call it fate.
000007.author: Carl Jung

000008.question: If your private thoughts were honest, how often would they contradict the person you present?
000008.quote: The most terrifying thing is to accept oneself completely.
000008.author: Carl Jung

000009.question: What habit do you call “who I am” that is really just something you never challenged?
000009.quote: We become what we do repeatedly.
000009.author: Will Durant

000010.question: If someone followed you for a week, would your actions reflect your values—or your fears?
000010.quote: Your actions are your loudest beliefs.
000010.author: Brendon Burchard

000011.question: If you woke up five years from now, what would tell you immediately that you stayed on the same path?
000011.quote: Change happens when the pain of staying the same is greater than the pain of change.
000011.author: Tony Robbins

000012.question: Picture your deathbed. An interviewer leans in and asks: 'What was the point?' You have one sentence. Say it now.
000012.quote: He who has a why to live can bear almost any how.
000012.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

000013.question: The universe grants you immunity from failure for one attempt. Just one. What do you try? Why haven't you tried it anyway?
000013.quote: What would you attempt to do if you knew you could not fail?
000013.author: Robert H. Schuller

000014.question: There's a parallel version of you who made the brave choice five years ago. What are they doing this morning that you're not?
000014.quote: In any moment of decision, the best thing you can do is the right thing. The worst is to do nothing.
000014.author: Theodore Roosevelt

000015.question: Fast-forward 20 years. Your grandchild asks: 'Did you ever go for it?' What do you want to be able to answer?
000015.quote: Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do.
000015.author: Mark Twain

000016.question: If someone replayed your last five difficult conversations, what pattern would they notice?
000016.quote: Between stimulus and response there is a space.
000016.author: Viktor Frankl

000017.question: Imagine you wake up tomorrow and nobody remembers you. No reputation. No history. Just you. Who would you finally allow yourself to be?
000017.quote: Freedom is what you do with what's been done to you.
000017.author: Jean-Paul Sartre

000018.question: Your phone unlocks with your most repeated inner lie. What's the passcode?
000018.quote: Above all, don't lie to yourself.
000018.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

000019.question: If you could only be known for one single truth about yourself—not achievement, not role—what would you want that truth to be? Now: do you live like it?
000019.quote: To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment.
000019.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

000020.question: A documentary camera follows you for 72 hours without your knowledge. Which scene would make you want the footage destroyed?
000020.quote: Character is what you do when nobody's watching.
000020.author: John Wooden

000021.question: If your comfort zone had a physical door, describe the view on the other side. Now explain why you keep the curtains closed.
000021.quote: Life begins at the end of your comfort zone.
000021.author: Neale Donald Walsch

000022.question: Here's a blank check signed by the universe. You can cash it on one act of creative rebellion. What do you make, start, or destroy?
000022.quote: Every act of creation is first an act of destruction.
000022.author: Pablo Picasso

000023.question: Your life has a 'skip' button. The parts people would skip—are those the parts you're living in right now?
000023.quote: Life is what happens when you're busy making other plans.
000023.author: John Lennon

000024.question: Pretend you already failed publicly. It happened. The embarrassment is over. Now what becomes possible?
000024.quote: What if I fall? Oh, but my darling, what if you fly?
000024.author: Erin Hanson

000025.question: You're given a single billboard on the busiest road in your city. It has to reveal a truth about your future direction. What does it say that scares you to admit?
000025.quote: The truth is like a lion; you don't have to defend it. Let it loose; it will defend itself.
000025.author: Augustine of Hippo

000026.question: Somewhere in your memory is a version of yourself you abandoned to become who you are. What did you trade away?
000026.quote: I am not who I think I am; I am not who you think I am; I am who I think you think I am.
000026.author: Thomas Cooley

000027.question: Your therapist has one free question they can ask that you must answer completely honestly. What question do you hope they never ask?
000027.quote: The first step toward change is awareness.
000027.author: Nathaniel Branden

000028.question: If every unkind thought you had today appeared as a bruise on your skin tomorrow, how would you look?
000028.quote: Be careful how you are talking to yourself because you are listening.
000028.author: Lisa M. Hayes

000029.question: A stranger describes you based only on your browser history, spending habits, and unread messages. How accurate is their portrait—and what did they get wrong that even you pretend to?
000029.quote: We buy things we don't need with money we don't have to impress people we don't like.
000029.author: Dave Ramsey

000030.question: You're on trial for the life you haven't lived. What's the prosecution's strongest evidence?
000030.quote: In the end, we only regret the chances we didn't take.
000030.author: Lewis Carroll

000031.question: An angel appears with two envelopes: 'Safe Path' and 'True Path.' You already know which one you've been choosing. Now the question is why.
000031.quote: Two roads diverged in a wood, and I—I took the one less traveled by.
000031.author: Robert Frost

000032.question: If your potential were a person standing behind you, and it could only speak in one word—what word would it keep whispering?
000032.quote: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today.
000032.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

000033.question: Pause. Imagine your best possible future—the one that makes your chest expand. Now: what's the first thing you'd have to stop doing today to earn it?
000033.quote: If you want something you've never had, you must be willing to do something you've never done.
000033.author: Thomas Jefferson

000034.question: Tomorrow at noon, one locked door in your life swings open. Not through luck—through a single act of courage. What door? What action?
000034.author: Virgil

000035.question: You're handed a microphone and 1 million people are listening. You can only speak about something you've never told anyone. The mic goes live in 5... 4... 3...
000035.quote: There is no agony like bearing an untold story inside you.
000035.author: Zora Neale Hurston

000036.question: List three things you 'don't have time for.' Now admit: which one are you actually just scared of?
000036.quote: Time is what we want most, but what we use worst.
000036.author: William Penn

000037.question: Your partner, best friend, or parent has one guess about your deepest insecurity. Are they right—and does it terrify you that they might know?
000037.quote: What we hide from others, we hide from ourselves.
000037.author: Unknown

000038.question: What do you Google at 2 AM that you'd never ask a human being?
000038.quote: We carry our secrets like stones, and they weigh us down.
000038.author: Unknown

000039.question: Reverse the telescope: look at yourself from a great distance. What pattern is obvious from up there that you can't see from inside your days?
000039.quote: We cannot solve our problems with the same thinking we used when we created them.
000039.author: Albert Einstein

000040.question: Which wound are you secretly proud of—the one you use as armor instead of letting it heal?
000040.quote: Out of suffering have emerged the strongest souls; the most massive characters are seared with scars.
000040.author: Khalil Gibran

000041.question: Describe the person you're becoming if nothing changes in the next five years. Is that description exciting or a warning?
000041.quote: We become what we repeatedly do.
000041.author: Sean Covey

000042.question: If your future success came with a warning label, what would it say? And are you willing to read the fine print now?
000042.quote: Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success.
000042.author: Albert Schweitzer

000043.question: Quick: someone offers you exactly what you've always wanted, but you have to leave in 24 hours and tell no one. Do you take it? The hesitation tells you something.
000043.quote: Jump, and a net will appear.
000043.author: John Burroughs

000044.question: The obituary is already written but the last paragraph is blank. You get to live it first. What does the final act look like?
000044.quote: Begin with the end in mind.
000044.author: Stephen Covey

000045.question: A stranger hands you a ticket. It says 'PERMISSION TO BE FULLY YOURSELF.' Why does getting permission from a stranger feel easier than giving it to yourself?
000045.quote: No one can make you feel inferior without your consent.
000045.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

000046.question: The thing you keep telling yourself you'll 'work on later'—what if later never comes? What have you been avoiding with that promise?
000046.quote: One day you will wake up and there won't be any more time to do the things you've always wanted.
000046.author: Paulo Coelho

000047.question: Your gut has been trying to tell you something for months. Finish its sentence: 'You already know that...'
000047.quote: The intuitive mind is a sacred gift and the rational mind is a faithful servant.
000047.author: Albert Einstein

000048.question: If your self-sabotage had a resume, what would be its greatest accomplishment?
000048.quote: We are our own worst enemy.
000048.author: Proverb

000049.question: You're handed a permission slip. It says: 'You are allowed to stop being ________.' What word belongs in that blank?
000049.quote: The greatest act of courage is to be and own all of who you are.
000049.author: Debbie Ford

000050.question: Somewhere there's a version of you that's happier. What did they do differently—and what are you afraid would happen if you did it too?
000050.quote: Don't ask what the world needs. Ask what makes you come alive.
000050.author: Howard Thurman

000051.question: A voice from the future calls. It's you, ten years older. You only have 30 seconds. What do you tell yourself? What do you hope the older you says back?
000051.quote: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.
000051.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

000052.question: Here's the exit. The exact moment you can leave behind the life you've outgrown. You've seen it a dozen times. Why do you keep driving past?
000052.quote: You cannot swim for new horizons until you have courage to lose sight of the shore.
000052.author: William Faulkner

000053.question: This is the question behind every question: What are you waiting for?
000053.quote: The time is always right to do what is right.
000053.author: Martin Luther King Jr.

000054.question: The project that scares you most right now—what would finishing it prove about you that you're not ready to believe?
000054.quote: Our deepest fear is not that we are inadequate. Our deepest fear is that we are powerful beyond measure.
000054.author: Marianne Williamson

000055.question: Your future self writes you a postcard from five years ahead. It just says: 'I wish you had started ______ sooner.' Fill in the blank.
000055.quote: The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago. The second best time is now.
000055.author: Chinese Proverb

000056.question: When silence enters the room, what uncomfortable thought rushes in to fill it?
000056.quote: Silence is the sleep that nourishes wisdom.
000056.author: Francis Bacon

000057.question: Write the negative review of yourself that you're terrified someone will post publicly. Now ask: who wrote the original draft inside your head?
000057.quote: No one can make you feel inferior without your consent.
000057.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

000058.question: If you recorded your self-talk for 24 hours, would you let anyone else listen to it? What would horrify them most?
000058.quote: You have been criticizing yourself for years, and it hasn't worked. Try approving of yourself and see what happens.
000058.author: Louise Hay

000059.question: Your shadow self walks into the room. What's the first thing it says that makes you look away?
000059.quote: One does not become enlightened by imagining figures of light, but by making the darkness conscious.
000059.author: Carl Jung

000060.question: What kindness have you been withholding from yourself that you give freely to others?
000060.quote: If your compassion does not include yourself, it is incomplete.
000060.author: Jack Kornfield

000061.question: What would you build if you knew it would fail beautifully—teaching you everything you need for the version that succeeds?
000061.quote: Ever tried. Ever failed. No matter. Try again. Fail again. Fail better.
000061.author: Samuel Beckett

000062.question: Imagine a version of you from a parallel universe where everything worked out. They're visiting for 10 minutes. What's the first question you ask them?
000062.quote: The only person you are destined to become is the person you decide to be.
000062.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

000063.question: Draw your comfort zone as a circle. Now draw where aliveness actually lives. How far apart are they?
000063.quote: Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one's courage.
000063.author: Anaïs Nin

000064.question: A lottery grants you one year of fearlessness. What do you do with month one?
000064.quote: Feel the fear and do it anyway.
000064.author: Susan Jeffers

000065.question: Someone bets you can't change one thing about your life in the next 48 hours. What do you prove them wrong about?
000065.quote: Action is the foundational key to all success.
000065.author: Pablo Picasso

000066.question: The secret you've never told anyone—not because it's scandalous, but because it's too tender. What is it?
000066.quote: Vulnerability is the birthplace of connection.
000066.author: Brené Brown

000067.question: Name the role you play so well that even you forgot it was a role. Who does that character protect?
000067.quote: We are what we pretend to be, so we must be careful about what we pretend to be.
000067.author: Kurt Vonnegut

000068.question: What's the nicest thing you believe about yourself—that you're terrified isn't actually true?
000068.quote: The most common way people give up their power is by thinking they don't have any.
000068.author: Alice Walker

000069.question: Write a one-sentence apology you owe someone—that you've been rehearsing for years but never delivered.
000069.quote: An apology is the superglue of life. It can repair just about anything.
000069.author: Lynn Johnston

000070.question: Trace the last lie you told. Follow it back. What fear was at the root?
000070.quote: The truth is always an insult or a joke, lies are generally tastier.
000070.author: Charles Bukowski

000071.question: Your future has two doors: 'Comfortable Decline' and 'Terrifying Growth.' You know which one you've been standing in front of. Why won't you knock?
000071.quote: Growth and comfort do not coexist.
000071.author: Ginni Rometty

000072.question: Write the headline of the article about your life in 10 years. Is it a celebration or a cautionary tale?
000072.quote: Begin with the end in mind.
000072.author: Stephen Covey

000073.question: What is being asked of you right now that you keep pretending you don't hear?
000073.quote: The universe is always speaking to us... sending us little messages.
000073.author: Nancy Thayer

000074.question: If you stopped playing it safe for exactly one month, what experiment would you run with your life?
000074.quote: Security is mostly a superstition. Life is either a daring adventure or nothing.
000074.author: Helen Keller

000075.question: What title would you put on the book of your unlived potential—and are you ready to write a different ending?
000075.quote: There is no greater agony than bearing an untold story inside you.
000075.author: Maya Angelou

000076.question: Someone who knew you at 16 runs into you today. What would shock them most—that hasn't changed?
000076.quote: We do not grow absolutely, chronologically. We grow sometimes in one dimension, and not in another.
000076.author: Anaïs Nin

000077.question: Write a thank-you note to the part of yourself you've been trying to kill.
000077.quote: Even darkness and pain serve a purpose.
000077.author: Unknown

000078.question: What truth have you learned that you wish you could unlearn?
000078.quote: The truth does not change according to our ability to stomach it.
000078.author: Flannery O'Connor

000079.question: What do you know for certain about yourself that you knew less certainly five years ago?
000079.quote: Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom.
000079.author: Aristotle

000080.question: Your grief carries a bag. What objects are inside?
000080.quote: Grief is the price we pay for love.
000080.author: Queen Elizabeth II

000081.question: Lightning round: Name one thing you'd do if you weren't worried about money. Now name one if you weren't worried about time. Now one if you weren't worried about judgment. What do all three have in common?
000081.quote: Tell me, what is it you plan to do with your one wild and precious life?
000081.author: Mary Oliver

000082.question: Your life is a book. You've just finished the first half. What genre does the second half want to be?
000082.quote: It's never too late to be what you might have been.
000082.author: George Eliot

000083.question: Tomorrow you have to give a TED talk on one thing you've learned. What's so important you'd stand on that stage for it?
000083.quote: The only thing standing between you and your goal is the story you keep telling yourself.
000083.author: Jordan Belfort

000084.question: You're granted one conversation with anyone in history. One condition: you have to answer their question first. Who do you choose, and what do they ask?
000084.quote: The art of questioning is the art of learning.
000084.author: Thomas Berger

000085.question: What impossible thing would you attempt if you could borrow someone else's confidence for six months?
000085.quote: Confidence comes not from always being right but from not fearing to be wrong.
000085.author: Peter T. McIntyre

000086.question: If your intuition sent you a text message right now, what would it say? And why haven't you replied?
000086.quote: The only real valuable thing is intuition.
000086.author: Albert Einstein

000087.question: What reality TV show of your inner life would get the highest ratings—and zero sponsors?
000087.quote: We are all actors in the theater of life.
000087.author: William Shakespeare

000088.question: Someone leaves a sticky note on your bathroom mirror that says the truth you need to hear. What's written on it?
000088.quote: Sometimes the truth hurts. And sometimes it feels real good.
000088.author: Henry Rollins

000089.question: Your ego writes a résumé. Your soul writes a counter-résumé. What makes each list?
000089.quote: The ego says, I shouldn't have to suffer. The spirit says, this pain is my teacher.
000089.author: Marianne Williamson

000090.question: You're on a jury judging yourself. What's the one charge where even your defense can't lie?
000090.author: Vincent van Gogh

000091.question: Your dream knocks on the door at 3 AM. It says: 'I'm leaving if you don't let me in.' What do you do?
000091.quote: Dreams don't work unless you do.
000091.author: John C. Maxwell

000092.question: You're allowed to fail spectacularly at something, once, with zero consequences. What do you attempt?
000092.quote: Success is stumbling from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm.
000092.author: Winston Churchill

000093.question: What commitment would you make if you knew for certain you'd be held to it forever?
000093.quote: Commitment is an act, not a word.
000093.author: Jean-Paul Sartre

000094.question: Your hesitation has a cost. Calculate it: what have you lost by waiting?
000094.quote: While we are postponing, life speeds by.
000094.author: Seneca

000095.question: You're granted 10,000 hours of focus. You can only spend them on one thing. What do you master?
000095.quote: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
000095.author: Steve Jobs

000096.question: Your anger carries a briefcase. Open it. What documents are inside?
000096.quote: Anger is an acid that can do more harm to the vessel in which it is stored than to anything on which it is poured.
000096.author: Mark Twain

000097.question: Describe the person you pretend to be on your best days. Now describe who shows up on your worst. Where's the overlap?
000097.quote: The authentic self is the soul made visible.
000097.author: Sarah Ban Breathnach

000098.question: What would your ten-year-old self cry about if they knew your current life? What would make them proud?
000098.quote: Every child is an artist. The problem is how to remain an artist once we grow up.
000098.author: Pablo Picasso

000099.question: Time freezes. Everyone around you is paused. You have one hour to do what you'd never do in front of them. What is it?
000099.quote: The cave you fear to enter holds the treasure you seek.
000099.author: Joseph Campbell

000100.question: Narrator voice: describe your morning routine as if documenting a stranger. What does the footage reveal?
000100.quote: How we spend our days is, of course, how we spend our lives.
000100.author: Annie Dillard
